column5: Does anyone have a picture of the ramp near gold pines in Ear Falls?As in an old previous post, I'm interested in knowing how "improved" or challenging the ramp is for launching my boat this summer.If anyone has a picture or two from past seasons, I'd love to see them.Scott
i don't have any pics, but i've been launching there for the last 10 yrs. Never any problem. Spudder

If you go to Gold Pines Resort web site: http://www.nwconx.net/~goldpine/ and click on the "Boats" & "Photos" picture you can see the boat ramp off on the left hand side. Not a great picture but gives you an idea. Hope this helps! 10 weeks and counting down the days to our trip to Lac Seul! RBF

It is one lane, but in good shape with a nice straight shot into the lake. Been using it for a number of years. It is in the foreground of this pic from Gold Pines.http://gi69.photobucket.com/groups/i...oldpines15.jpg KT

The ramp is paved about one lane wide. That means you back straight down to launch your boat. I have witnessed several guys fall off the side of the pavement. Obviously, they didn't back down straight. But thats a whole different story.
It drops off nicely. No worries about depth.
